edu.harvard.util

Class ExternalProcess

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.harvard.util.ExternalProcess
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cancelable

    public class ExternalProcess
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cancelable
    A handle to an external process
    Author:
    Peter Macko

      Initialize the process.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExternalProcess

        public ExternalProcess(java.lang.String cmd)
        Initialize the process. Note that running the process using an external shell might result in cancel() not working properly.
        Parameters:
        cmd - the command to run using /bin/sh

      • ExternalProcess

        public ExternalProcess(java.lang.String[] cmds)
        Initialize the process
        Parameters:
        cmds - the command and arguments to run using Java's Runtime

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public java.io.OutputStream start()
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Start a program and return its input stream
        Returns:
        the program output
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred

      • getProcessOutputStream

        public java.io.InputStream getProcessOutputStream()
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Get the output stream of the process
        Returns:
        the output stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred

      • finish

        public java.lang.String finish()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Finish the program started with start() - capture the output, wait for completion, and throw an exception if its execution failed.
        Returns:
        the program output
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred

      • run

        public java.lang.String run()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Run a program, capture the output, wait for completion, and throw an exception if its execution failed. If the program is already running, the behavior of this method is undefined.
        Returns:
        the program output
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancel the task
